photo.description: One ingenious moment: A monk is sitting in a sunbeam. By reading of prayers (mantra) are body and spirit in harmony to each other. Photographed in the monastery of Hemis in Ladakh, India. Durch häufiges Rezitieren von Gebeten (mantra) sollen Körper und Geist in Harmonie gerbracht werden.

photo.title: One ingenious moment

photo.description: A few summers ago, I spent a couple of months living in Ladakh. Ladakh is a region of Kashmir, India high in the Himalaya Mountains. Descended from Tibetans and traders along the Silk Road, Ladakh is religiously Buddhist, but maintains it's own language and traditions. It was "opened" to development only in the 1970's, before which the people there were subsistence farmers. In the arid climate, they developed a technically and socially complex irrigation system allowing for wheat, barley, and vegetables to be grown. I lived with a family in the remote village of Likir for one month. During that time, the annual festival at Hemis Monastery occurred and I traveled to see it. It was a full day, and on into the night, of costumed dancing and chanting. I've never before or since seen anything like it.
photo.tags: ladakh hemis goodtimes monastery
photo.title: Hemis Festival
